chunk_title: Objectives and Justification of the TC
text: The  Technical  Cooperation  is  expected  to  deliver  direct  and  indirect  economic  and social benefits for the entire country and to the aviation sector. The main beneficiaries of  the  TC  will  be  the  Ministry  of  Tourism,  Investment  and  Aviation  (MoTIA)  and  the Ministry of Works and Family Island Affairs MoW&FIA.

The specific objectives are: (i) create a Regional Roadmap for city climate finance; (ii) generate and share knowledge through exchange of experiences and best practices; (iii) strengthen dialogue among cities and stakeholders; and (iv) scale up climate finance strategies by providing access to expert advice, training, and tools.

6.1 Working with government entities entails the risk of discontinuity due to slow response and staff changes at different levels. The TC will mitigate these risks through continuous dialogue and monitoring.

chunk_title: Objectives and Justification of the TC
text:
The  TC  considers  six  consultancy  services,  four  of  which  will  be  carried  out  as 
corporate procurement services and two as individual consultancies. The consultancy 
services span the years 2026 and 2027. The earliest consultancy services will start in 
January 2026, following a hiring process conducted in November 2025. Therefore, the 
TC resources should be available by the start of November 2025 to avoid delays in 
the execution.

chunk_title: Description of Activities – Component II: Water and Sanitation Rural & Urban Sectoral Dialogue
text: 3.2 Component II: This component will finance activities to support the National Government entities in charge of the W&S sector to strengthen their capacity and promote dialogue related to the improvement of W&S providers' performance.

chunk_title: Objective and Justification – Knowledge Dissemination on Water Security
text: 2.1 The objective of this technical cooperation is to share knowledge products developed through the implementation of the Water Security Strategy and the Transboundary Program of INE/WSA at the COP 30 and events pre-COP. This includes promoting the recently approved program funded by GCF and IDB, “Improving Climate Resilience by Increasing Water Security in the Amazon Basin.” While this TC focuses on the Amazon basin, it will also incorporate technical expertise and lessons learned from TCs executed in other regions of LAC. The aim is to provide reference knowledge products from these regions on water resilience, that can serve as replicable case studies for the Amazon, particularly in the context of COP30 in Belém, Brazil. The specific objectives of this TC are: (1) support the development and dissemination of knowledge products and communication materials on water resilience and the implementation of Nature-based Solutions (NbS) in the water and sanitation sector, (2) facilitate technical and political dialogues related to these knowledge products in preparation for the COP30, and (3) promote the dissemination of the GCF Water Security Program in the Amazon.

chunk_title: Objective and Justification – Santo Domingo System Stress and Strategic Alignment
text: 2.3 In Santo Domingo, the capital and most densely populated urban center, the water supply system is under severe stress due to urban growth, high non-revenue water levels, and aging infrastructure. In 2022, over 1.6 million m³/day of potable water were produced, but only 39% of wastewater was collected. The proposed operation will strengthen water security by diversifying water sources, modernizing infrastructure, and improving water resource management. This Technical Cooperation is fully aligned with the IDB’s Institutional Strategy 2020–2030, particularly with its strategic priorities of (i) promoting social inclusion and equality by improving access to basic services such as water and sanitation; (ii) enhancing productivity and innovation by strengthening the efficiency and resilience of water infrastructure in key urban and tourism areas; and (iii) addressing climate change and environmental sustainability by promoting the protection of natural resources, climate-resilient investments, and the reuse of treated wastewater.
This Technical Cooperation aims to support the implementation of the Sustainable and Inclusive Urban Development Program...

IV. Budget – Indicative Budget (in US$): Component I Knowledge Generation: $50,000. Component II Knowledge Sharing and Outreach: $50,000. Component III Dissemination of the GCF Water Security Program in the Amazon: $50,000. Total: $150,000.
The Ministry of Finance, Economic Development, and Investment will act as Executing Agency...

chunk_title: Component II – Primary Data Collection and Capacity Building
text: 3.2 Component II: Primary Data Collection and Capacity Building. This component will implement a survey pilot, baseline household surveys, and training for COHAPAR staff. Activities include refining instruments, data collection, and capacity building in evaluation methods. Outputs: training, pilot, and data collection reports, plus dataset for analysis.

Environmental and Social Aspects 7.1 This Technical Cooperation is intended to finance pre-feasibility or feasibility studies of specific investment projects and the environmental and social studies associated with them; therefore, the terms of reference and products of this TC will be consistent with the applicable requirements of the Bank’s Environmental and Social Policy Framework (ESPF).

chunk_title: Challenges: Knowledge Gaps and Limited Technology
text: LAC cities face challenges implementing climate adaptation actions due to limited information, monitoring tools, technology, and incremental responses that are insufficient to meet environmental challenges. Strengthening the information base and monitoring tools is necessary.

chunk_title: Objective and Justification – Service Gaps and Climate Challenges
text: 2.2 In Mexico, water, sanitation and solid waste operators face challenges in several fronts, including improvement of efficiency and reduction of GHG emissions, management of water resources incorporating the impacts of climate change, resiliency against natural disasters, integrated solid waste management and circular economy. Although Mexico has high levels of potable water and sewerage coverage (96.1% in both cases, in 2020), in 2022, only 43% of the population had access to safe water supplies and 63% to hygienic sanitation services. These deficiencies have adverse impacts on the health and the economic welfare of the population.

chunk_title: Objectives and Justification of the TC
text:
The  objective  of  this  Technical  Cooperation  is  to  provide  support  for  sustainable 
aviation in The Bahamas including the development of a sustainable aviation strategy, 
studies  to  support  the  adoption  of  sustainable  aviation  fuels,  the  design  of  green, 
climate  resilient  and  energy  efficient  aerodromes,  and  programs  that  promote  labor 
force development, human capacity building and social inclusion in the aviation sector.

The main populated towns in northern Belize are Orange Walk, Corozal, and San Pedro... These municipalities face challenges including urban services deficits, lack of economic diversification, vulnerability to natural risks...

chunk_title: Description of Activities and Outputs – Component III: Financial and Governance Mechanism
text: 3.3 Component III: Design of the Financial and Governance Mechanism for Coral Sustainability. This component will establish a financial and governance framework to ensure the sustainability of restoration efforts, integrating innovation, transparency, and inclusive participation, with a national-level monitoring approach to assess the status and evolution of coral reefs across the country.
